field.comment: The id of whoever created the task
field.name: creator

field.comment: Who has to perform the task? This can be a specific user, a group, a server or $all, $any...
field.name: target

field.comment: The id of who currently owns the task
field.name: owner

field.comment: The state of the task, it is either WAITING, RUNNING, ERROR (temporary), FAILED, SUCCEEDED
field.name: state

field.comment: This task may depend on another task that has to be in a final state before this one can start
field.name: dependencyId

field.comment: In case we are part of a batch, this is the index inside the batch for sequential processing
field.name: taskIndex

field.comment: The task to run, this could for example be a service id.
field.name: task

field.comment: The type of the task, this allows for example schedulers to exist next to asynchronous service runs
field.name: taskType

field.comment: Content of the task, for example xmlified input of a service
field.name: taskInput

field.comment: If based on a schedule, this is the timestamp of the instance. This allows us to make sure only one such instance exists. Because we set a unique constraint on this in combination with the task id we always need a sensible value.
field.name: scheduled

field.comment: When the task was done executing
field.name: stopped

field.comment: There are three times of interest: created indicates when the task was initially created, started means when the actor started performing the task and stopped is when it stopped
field.name: started

field.comment: The parent task (if any), it is a way to link tasks to one another.
field.name: parentId

field.comment: You can use this field to link the task to something arbitrary (e.g. cms nodes)
field.name: correlationId

field.comment: A grouping within a single queue. This is for the user to group tasks together logically
field.name: groupId

field.comment: An id that identifies the content-to-be-processed for the task. For instance if you want to start processing an invoice, this could be the invoice number. This is a logical identifier for lookup purposes.
field.name: contextId

field.comment: The service context that should be set for the execution of this task
field.name: serviceContext

field.comment: Allow a task to run as a certain user
field.name: alias

field.comment: Allow a task to run in a certain realm
field.name: realm

field.comment: The unique identifier of the user
field.name: authenticationId

field.comment: The alias of the impersonator (if any)
field.name: impersonator

field.comment: The realm of the impersonator
field.name: impersonatorRealm

field.comment: The unique identifier of the impersonator
field.name: impersonatorId
